column5: This past week we headed up to scotsman point resort on Upper Buckhorn Lake for the 13th consecutive year. It is a family vacation but for my dad and I it is a chance to spend as much time on the water as possible.  The week started off with a BANG as we landed 20 + bass the first morning. Didn't take many pictures because they were all cookie cutter 1.5 to 2 lbers but it was a BLAST. We get into a couple pigs, my dad landed a nice one and I lost a 3 plus largie that threw my spinner bait. Also lost a spinnerbait to a musky that would have completed the Buckhorn Grand Slam on the first day for me, Largemouth, Smallmouth, Walleye, Musky. As we were drifting past a large weedbed with pencil weeds sticking out I was talking about how there HAS to be a musky in there, just waiting to ambush. Next cast, mid sentence talking about the shark that should be in there a 40" class fish explodes on my spinnerbait, and ends up biting right through my 40 lb PP.  Here is a sample of that first morning.       The fishing got tough that night as a thunderstorm rolled in, caught some fish but nothing to write home about.  The weather was NOT co operative the past week, cold fronts and almost unfishable winds made us work hard for every fish, but we enjoyed the challenge. Never really found the pattern, and I dont think there was one. The weather had the fish scattered, we would find pockets of active fish but they were really random.  The first night brought me a 15" eye, that met the hot butter bath without a picture, but while im on the subject here are some other eyes that were caught and released. The first one took at spook right at dark and actually JUMPED TWICE.    spinnerbait eye    this one took a frog at night off the dock    Back to the bassin, and as you can see we were fighting the cold alot, look at how we are dressed in all these pictures...    this fish was bleeding alot, but was hardly hooked in the top lip, we couldnt figure out how it was bleeding from the gills?   Finally got a blue bird day, high winds and NO FISH though.  Gave up on bassin and caught 30 or more of these guys...    Also this fiesty guy...for reference that bait is 1.5" long...    Minnows off the dock at nighttime brought me these within 3 minutes of each other...      All things done, it was another amazing year.  Fishing was tougher than usual, but it challenged me on a lake that I know well, and I branched out for some other species that I dont usually fish. This is only a small sample, we did catch lots more bass that just didnt warrant a picture, and this was the first year in the last 6 that we did not land at least one 4lber.  Tight lines.

Very nice Kemper. Looks like you had a great family trip and some beauty fish to show for it. Scotsman's sure is a nice resort and right close to some great fishing there.  Thanks for the report  Mike

Can't complain about the quantity of fish you guys caught and a good variety I might say  There's some great lookin bass there and the eyes...... well I just lov'm  Great report kemper and thanks for sharing  Leechman
thanks guys, ive got some more pics comin when i have time
nice buckets!
sweet nice fish
Sounds like a great weekend! Must be nice to be right on a Kawartha lake for an entire week! Looks like the bass and pickerel and crappie were co-operating. Good job!
Too bad about that muskie man, would have been a great photo to add.
Great report and pics!!!  What're y'all doing with all those clothes on???
this here ain't 'bama dog!  Kawarthas are in the great white north EH!
good on ya kemper.  I did notice I didn't see any POP like I have in some of your other pic's...
it was cola GBW, always cola...
Ahh yes, that cool refreshing drink it was...
Looks like a great time, wish my dad lived closer than England, but my father in law loves to fish when he comes up here.  Great report, great pics, thanks for sharing.
thanks all, still workin on some more pics
Good report man, thanks for sharing.
awesome report man, some beauty colors on those fish
Nice fishing report/trip !!!! some very nice sized bass & crappies too,great to have a fishing vacation with family man well done !!!..cheers
Nice fishing report/trip,great pics too,some very nice sized bass & crappies as well...cheers

Nice to have a family fishing vacation on Buckhorn, too bad about the weather at least you caught some fish. I've noticed more bass of a smaller size up that way as well. Four or five lb. fish are less common last few years for sure. Great report, ehg

Spending a week up there eh. Ain't that nice, i wish that my family would do something like that. Very nice report kemper, seems that you almost caught every specie that swims in there.  walleye on a frog? lol that's interesting
Sounds like a great vacation, thanks for posting.
Try it out, off just about any dock in the kawarthas you can catch walleye on a frog at night, just make sure to check the regs because there is only one type of frog you are allowed to use as bait
Very cool trip and report.
